intro: Diascia montana, commonly known as the mountain diascia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with hairy, upright stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
